Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal.`` Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media. Michael Gove , the Education Secretary, said`` profound mistakes'' made with the curriculum by Labour led to England plummeting in international league tables. Writing in The Daily Telegraph today, he said: The top-performing education nations all have rigorous curricula which act as a benchmark for achievement and a guide to essential knowledge.`` But while we have one of the biggest curricula in the world- at nearly 500 pages- it has failed a generation by not preparing them for the modern world.`` The existing national curriculum embodies poverty of aspiration. A new priMary Bousted and secondary school curriculum is expected to be in place by September 2013. But last night, teachers' leaders accused ministers of advocating a return to the`` public school curriculum

n't make a virtual omelet without getting a few eggheads scrambled. This clash of the tech titans is captured by POLITICO's Elizabeth Wasserman in a slice of the type of reporting you can expect from POLITICO Pro. Google is under siege in Washington like never before- and it says an` anti-Google industrial complex' is to blame. In an interview with POLITICO, a Google spokesman argued that a cabal of antitrust Jude Lawyers, lobbyists and public relations firms is conspiring against the Internet search giant. The mastermind? Google says it's Microsoft, Wasserman reports.`` Maybe it's iRon Kirky, or maybe it's payback.
